N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16ยง 311.1 - Classification of utilities

State Regulations
(a) For the
purpose of applying systems of accounts prescribed by the commission, utilities
are divided into four classes as follows: (1)

Class A. Utilities having annual gas operating revenues of $2,500,000 or
more. (2)

Class B. Utilities having
annual gas operating revenues of $1,000,000 or more but less than
$2,500,000. (3)

Class C. Utilities
having annual gas operating revenues of $150,000 or more but less than
$1,000,000. (4)

Class D. Utilities
having annual gas operating revenues of $25,000 or more but less than
$150,000. (b) This
system of accounts applies to Class A and Class B utilities. The system of
accounts applicable to Class C and Class D utilities is issued
separately. (c) The class to which
any utility belongs shall originally be determined by the average of its annual
gas operating revenues for the last three consecutive years. Subsequent changes
in classification shall be made when the annual gas operating revenues for each
of the three immediately preceding years shall exceed the upper limit, or be
less than the lower limit, of the annual gas operating revenues of the
classification previously applicable to the utility. Notes
